result.execSummary:
The defendant Hope Ann Askenette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hope Ann Askenette is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hope Ann Askenette was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (2/13/15) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer - Defendant is entitled to 32 days presentence credit - TIME SERVED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hope Ann Askenette in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Atty. Vollan heard on recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to OAR in Count 3; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; parties stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of OAR in Count 3 w/Count 2 D&RI; State heard; Atty. Vollan heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

* 32 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. - Credit for 32 days - TIME SERVED
* $243 CC
* $200 DNA surcharge
Return date on December 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Hope Ann Askenette in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Court reschedules to next week.  Return date scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
NO FELONY CHARGES LEFT IN THIS CASE.  NO PROBABLE CAUSE FOUND IN COUNT 1 AT INITIAL THEREFORE COUNT 1 WAS DISMISSED
Defendant shall not go on the premises at Kohls, Beaver Dam, WI;  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

(12:46) Defendant Hope Ann Askenette in court, in custody via video w/SPD intern Austin Heimann with attorney Jessica M. Moeller.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court does not find prob cause for the MOWOC but will proceed on the OAR and BJ chgs; State requests cash bail; Intern Heimann responds; Court dismiss count 1; Court orders $500 cash; may make phone call;     Defendant shall not go on the premises at Kohl's in Beaver Dam, WI;  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Return date scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
